articles.title: Milan lose again after 25 days: Parma conquers San Siro
articles.summary: Milan lose again in the league after 25 games. Massimiliano Allegri's team fell against Carlos Cuesta's Parma, who with sacrifice, cunning but above all cynicism brought home 3 very important points with a view to survival.

articles.title: Gabbia avoids refereeing controversies: "We must have the strength not to be influenced by these decisions. It's not up to us to judge"
articles.summary:
Matteo Gabbia, AC Milan defender, spoke to TeleLombardia at the end of Milan-Parma 0-1. These are his words:

How are you?

“I could have been better, I'll see with the doctors what happened tonight.

articles.title: An obvious block turned into an obvious error
articles.summary: After 24 useful results in a row in Serie A, Milan lose again in the championship.

articles.title: Marelli: "According to the regulations, the goal did not have to be validated"
articles.summary:
Luca Marelli, referee commentator for DAZN, thus analyzed the controversial episode that gave Parma the winning goal. His statements:

articles.title: LIVE MN - Gabbia: "The climate is not good, the mood is not the best. There are situations against the small teams that cause us difficulties"
articles.summary: Matteo Gabbia, Milan defender, is present in the press conference at the end of Milan-Como, recovery of the 24th matchday of Serie A. Follow his statements live with the live text on MilanNews.

articles.title: LIVE MN - Strefezza: "I didn't see what happened with Valenti. During the week we prepared counterattacks and dead balls"
articles.summary: Gabriel Strefezza, Parma striker, is present in the press conference at the end of Milan-Como, recovery of the 24th matchday of Serie A. Follow his statements live with the live text on MilanNews.

articles.title: Gabbia: "Tomorrow I'll take the exams. There's a lot of bitterness, a lot of disappointment, it's something that must help us grow"
articles.summary:
Matteo Gabbia spoke to DAZN despite not taking the field after a muscle problem he encountered in the warm-up. His words:

How are you? You were supposed to play but you stopped in the warm-up.

articles.title: ‘The thing that hurts the most’ – Gabbia bitter after unbeaten run ends against Parma
articles.summary: AC Milan defender Matteo Gabbia has admitted that the unbeaten run ending at the hands of Parma ‘hurts’, also sending his thoughts to Ruben Loftus-Cheek. Gabbia was expected to start the game against Parma this evening, but the defender pulled up during the warm-ups complaining of muscle discomfort.
